skill.name: Thinking Deeply
skill.description: Engages structured analysis to explore multiple perspectives and context dependencies before responding. Use when users ask confirmation-seeking questions, make leading statements, request binary choices, or when feeling inclined to quickly agree or disagree without thorough consideration.
skill.summary: Prevents automatic responses by enforcing multi-perspective analysis and structured thinking before answering
skill.author: Community

content.value_statement: AI assistants often provide quick answers without exploring nuances. This skill enforces structured multi-perspective analysis before responding, ensuring answers consider context, trade-offs, and alternative viewpoints.
actual_capabilities: Detects confirmation-seeking questions and leading statements
Identifies embedded assumptions in user queries
Provides context-dependent recommendations with clear reasoning
Transforms binary choices into balanced trade-off analyses
Delivers responses using structured analysis framework
limitations: Does not access external data or APIs
Only activates on trigger patterns, not continuous analysis
Does not modify system files or execute code
Cannot verify factual claims against external sources

use_cases.title: Evaluate Technology Choices
use_cases.description: Get balanced framework comparisons instead of biased recommendations for programming languages, libraries, and architectural patterns.

use_cases.title: Make Informed Decisions
use_cases.description: Receive context-dependent analysis of trade-offs before committing to product strategies, feature prioritization, or technical approaches.

use_cases.title: Explore Multiple Viewpoints
use_cases.description: Get comprehensive analysis that considers alternative perspectives and hidden factors in complex analytical questions.

prompt_templates.title: Architectural Decision

prompt_templates.title: Tool Selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Should I use TypeScript or JavaScript for this project?

prompt_templates.title: Complex Trade-offs
prompt_templates.prompt: Should we build or buy this software component?

output_examples.input: Is React better than Vue for my project?
output: Let me think about this more carefully. Rather than asking which is 'better', the key question is which framework fits your specific requirements, team capabilities, and constraints.
For React: Larger ecosystem, more flexibility, better for complex apps, steeper learning curve.
For Vue: Gentler learning curve, excellent documentation, strong for rapid development, smaller ecosystem.
The best choice depends on: Team experience, project complexity, timeline, and hiring needs.
Recommendation: React for complex long-term apps with experienced teams; Vue for rapid development with junior developers.

best_practices: Use when asking about technology choices, architectural decisions, or strategic recommendations
Apply the reframing step to identify the real underlying question
Always identify context dependencies that influence recommendations
anti_patterns: Do not accept the user's framing without questioning assumptions
Avoid giving simple yes/no answers without exploring trade-offs
Do not present only one perspective as universally correct

faq.question: When does this skill activate?
faq.answer: It triggers on confirmation questions, leading statements, binary choices, and situations where you feel inclined to quickly agree or disagree.

faq.question: Does this skill access external APIs?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure prompt template that modifies Claude's response behavior without external network calls.

faq.question: Can I customize when it triggers?
faq.answer: Yes. Modify the description field in Skill.md to make triggering more specific or broader.

faq.question: Will it slow down responses?
faq.answer: Minimal overhead. The structured analysis adds brief processing time for better quality responses.

faq.question: What questions should I ask?
faq.answer: Technology comparisons, architectural decisions, tool selection, and any choice with significant trade-offs benefit most.

faq.question: Is this skill safe for production use?
faq.answer: Yes. It contains no executable code, only prompt instructions that guide Claude's reasoning process.
